Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  org.reprap.geometry.polygons.Polygon

public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object

The main boundary-representation polygon class

nearestVertexReorderMerge

public boolean nearestVertexReorderMerge(Polygon p,
                                         double linkUp)
Find the nearest vertex on this polygon to any on polygon p, reorder p so that its nearest is its first one, then merge that polygon into this one. The reordering is only done if the distance^2 is less than linkUp. If no reordering and merging are done false is returned, otherwise true is returned.

Parameters:
p -
linkUp -
Returns:

Returns:

backStepExtrude

public void backStepExtrude(double d)
Backtrack a given distance, inserting a new point there and set extrudeEnd to it. If extrudeEnd is already set, backtrack from that.

Parameters:
distance - to backtrack

simplify

public Polygon simplify(double d)
Simplify a polygon by deleting points from it that are closer than d to lines joining other points NB - this ignores speeds

Parameters:
d -
Returns:
simplified polygon object

arcCompensate

public Polygon arcCompensate()
Offset (some of) the points in the polygon to allow for the fact that extruded circles otherwise don't come out right. See http://reprap.org/bin/view/Main/ArcCompensation. If the extruder for the polygon's arc compensation factor is 0, return the polygon unmodified. This ignores speeds

Parameters:
es -

setSpeeds

public void setSpeeds(double airSpeed,
                      double minSpeed,
                      double maxSpeed,
                      double acceleration)
Set the speeds at each vertex so that the polygon can be plotted as fast as possible

Parameters:
minSpeed -
maxSpeed -
maxAcceleration -

Returns:
Convex hull as a polygon

Parameters:

Returns:
